Pre-Game Insights: India’s head coach Rahul Dravid praised Afghanistan’s performance in the tournament thus far and said they are 'a very dangerous team' in the T20 format.
Afghanistan coach Jonathan Trott believes his side will not be overawed by the occasion nor the opponents in Thursday’s match and will take it on 'like any [other] game'.
Trott admitted India will be favourites to win the game but that will also add pressure on Rohit Sharma’s team.
India will be wary of Afghanistan’s bowling attack, which is led by the tournament’s top wicket-taker Fazalhaq Farooqi in the pace department and Rashid in spin.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in Barbados has not been a bowler’s paradise, it has offered some assistance in holding back the run-scoring, with only one team – Australia – crossing the 200-run mark.
Teams winning the toss have chosen to field first in all five games at the venue thus far.
The weather is not expected to have a big role to play as it is a rain-free forecast with partial cloud cover and humid conditions during the day.
India command a 7-0 lead over Afghanistan in their eight T20 encounters, while one game ended in a 'no result'.
Afghanistan have played all four of their group matches in the Caribbean, while this will be India’s first in the region.
Others: The article discusses the upcoming match between Afghanistan and India in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 Super Eight, with both teams having played three games each in the tournament so far.
The article highlights the challenges faced by both teams, with Afghanistan looking to take on the top-ranked T20 team, India, while India will be wary of Afghanistan’s bowling attack.
